instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not powering on
threads.message:
Hello,
I've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't power on.
The client says that the laptop begin to freeze and now it doesn't power on.
I've notice that the <CAPACITOR>C0809</CAPACITOR> had some corrosion, and after cleaning the area, the pin 1 of the <CAPACITOR>C8190</CAPACITOR> (no stuff) was gone. I've replaced the <CAPACITOR>C0809</CAPACITOR> with a new one but still not powering on.
The voltage in the <RESISTOR>R8190</RESISTOR> reach the 3.3V but drops to 0 after a few seconds. Should i make a jumper from pin 6 of <CHIP>U8020</CHIP> to the <RESISTOR>R8190</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not powering on
threads.message:
Please post helpfull information.
You didn't say anything about G3H voltages, or <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS; stable, or not?
Did you check any signal from power on sequence?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not powering on
threads.message:
Sorry,...
Now, it has no green light on the charger (a while ago it had green light and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was 8.6V).
now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0.2V.
On F7140 it has also 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 2.8V (7.8 k ohm to ground)
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 19.9V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> = 19.9V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not powering on
threads.message: After reflowing <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> it start to work again, and apparently it's normal. What do you thing i should do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not powering on
threads.message: If works, nothing more than testing it in time...
